PreparerFirmName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: Philip T Charon and Co PLLC

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: HISTORIC FORT WORTH, INC. IS DEDICATED TO PRESERVING FORT WORTH' UNIQUE HISTORIC IDENTITY THROUGH STEWARDSHIP, EDUCATION AND LEADERSHIP.
IRS990.Desc: BUILDING PRESERVATION: HISTORIC FORT WORTH, INC. OWNS, MAINTAINS AND RESTORED TWO PROPERTIES, THE 1904 WHARTON-SCOTT HOUSE, KNOWN AS THISTLE HILL, AND THE BALL-EDDLEMAN-MCFARLAND HOUSE. BOTH PROPERTIES ARE USED AS HOUSE MUSEUMS, RENTAL PROPERTIES AND EDUCATIONAL VENUES FOR ADULTS AND CHILDREN.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: EDUCATION: HISTORIC FORT WORTH, INC. INFORMS THE COMMUNITY OF HISTORIC PROPERTIES THAT DESERVE PRESERVATION, GRANTS AWARDS TO THOSE WHO DO PRESERVATION WORK, CONDUCTS SURVEYS OF HISTORICAL RESOURCES IN THE CITY, AND PROVIDES PRESERVATION EDUCATION TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC AND TO THOSE INFLUENCING PROPERTY, LIKE REALTORS, DEVELOPERS, ETC.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: Other Income Part II, Line 10 Description: OTHER INCOME 2013: 54149. 2014: 31615. 2015: 13350. 2016: 11558. 2017: 17051.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: OWNER AGREES AT ALL TIMES TO PRESERVE AND MAINTAIN THE FACADE IN A FIRST-CLASS, GOOD, AND SOUND STATE OF REPAIR AT OWNER'S SOLE COST AND EXPENSE AND TO PERFORM SUCH MAINTENANCE AND MAKE SUCH REPAIRS IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE STANDARDS FOR REHABILITIATION AND GUIDELINES FOR REHABILITATING HISTORIC BUILDINGS (THE "STANDARDS")ISSUED BY THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE OF THE UNITED STATES DEARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR. AT LEAST ONCE EVERY FIVE (5) YEARS, THE OWNER SHALL PROVIDE TO HISTORIC FORT WORTH AN INSPECTION REPORT OF THE CONDITION OF THE FACADE AND THE STRUCTURAL ELEMENTS OF THE BUILDING. HISTORIC FORT WORTH ALSO HAS THE RIGHT TO REQUIRE THAT THE OWNER CAUSE AN INSPECTION OF THE BUILDING FROM TIME TO TIME, UPON HISTORIC FORT WORTH'S BELIEF THAT A SPECIAL INSPECTION IS NECESSARY TO ACCOMPLISH THE PURPOSES OF THE EASEMENT.

THE ORGANIZATION FOLLOWS THE ACCOUNTING PRACTICE OF NOT INCLUDING IN ITS ASSETS THE COST OR APPRAISED VALUE OF ANY HISTORIC SITES, WHICH UPON RECEIPT MAY BE RETAINED BY THE ORGANIZATION. RELATED EXPENDITURES FOR RESTORATION, STABILIZATION, RECONSTRUCTION, AND DEVELOPMENT ARE CHARGED TO EXPENSE AS INCURRED. PROPERTITES ACCEPTED WITH THE INTENT OF SALE ARE RECOGNIZED AS REVENUE AT THE TIME OF DONATION BASED ON ESTIMATED FAIR VALUE LESS COSTS FOR HISTORIC EVALUATION, REPAIR, AND MAINTENANCE COSTS, AND THE IMPACT OF THE EASEMENT. THE HISTORIC SITES, INCLUDING OBJECTS AND FURNISHINGS, OWNED BY THE ORGANIZATION WITH THE INTENT OF RETENTION ARE NOT REPORTED IN THE ACCOMPANYING STATEMENT OF FINANCIAL POSITION UNDER THE ACCOUNTING POLICY STATED ABOVE.

THE ORGANIZATION OWNS, OPERATES, MAINTAINS,AND RESTORES TWO HISTORIC PROPERTIES IN FORT WORTH, TEXAS THAT ARE CLASSIFIED AS COLLECTION PROPERTIES. THEY ARE THE 1899 BALL-EDDLEMAN-MCFARLAND HOUSE ("MCFARLAND") LOCATED AT 1110 PENN STREET, INSURED FOR APPROXIMATELY $5,100,000 AND THE 1903 WHARTON-SCOTT HOUSE KNOWN AS THISTLE HILL LOCATED AT 1509 PENNSYLVANIA AVENUE, INSURED FOR APPROXIMATELY $8,000,000. BOTH PROPERTIES OPERATE AS MUSEUM SPACE, AS WELL AS EVENT SPACE, FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC. THE BALL-EDDLEMAN-MCFARLAND HOUSE ALSO SERVES AS A LIBRARY FOR HISTORIC RESEARCH IN ITS PRESERVATION RESOURCE CENTER LOCATED IN THE LOWER FLOOR, ALL OF WHICH FURTHERS THE EXEMPT PURPOSE OF HISTORIC FORT WORTH, INC. TO PRESERVE FORT WORTH, TEXAS'S UNIQUE HISTORIC IDENTITY THROUGH STEWARDSHIP, EDUCATION AND LEADERSHIP.

IN 1996, TEXAS HERITAGE, INC. ESTABLISHED A $400,000 THISTLE HILL ENDOWMENT FUND. ON JANUARY 1, 2006, HISTORIC FORT WORTH, INC. RECEIVED THE PROPERTY KNOWN AS THISTLE HILL AND ITS ENDOWMENT FUND AS GIFTS FROM TEXAS HERITAGE, INC. ON THE DATE OF THE TRANSFER, THE THISTLE HILL ENDOWMENT FUND, MANAGED BY FROST BANK, TOTALED $217,311. THE FINANCE COMMITTEE IS AUTHORIZED TO SPEND UP TO 5% OF THE BALANCE OF THE FUND EXCLUSIVELY ON THISTLE HILL. THIS AMOUNT IS CALCULATED ON THE BALANCE AS OF THE PREVIOUS YEAR ENDED DECEMBER 31. FUNDS ARE PLACED IN THE OPERATING ACCOUNT TO BE USED ONLY FOR MAINTENANCE, IMPROVEMENTS, OR RESTORATION OF THISTLE HILL MAIN HOUSE OR THE CARRIAGE HOUSE. ANY ADDITIONAL FUNDS TRANSFERRED FROM THE THISTLE HILL ENDOWMENT FUND WILL ALSO BE USED ONLY FOR MAINTENANCE, IMPROVEMENTS, OR RESTORATION OF THISTLE HILL MAIN HOUSE OR THE CARRIAGE HOUSE AND WILL BE RECOMMENDED BY THE FINANCE COMMITTEE TO THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE AND/OR THE BOARD.
$44,254 SPECIAL EVENTS EXPENSES NET AGAINST REVENUE
$44,254 SPECIAL EVENTS EXPENSES NET AGAINST REVENUE
THE TREASURER, BOARD PRESIDENT, AND EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR HAVE REVIEWED DRAFTS OF THE FORM 990 FOR THE PAST SEVEN YEARS.

BOARD MEMBERS DISCLOSE CONFLICTS OF INTEREST, AND THE BOARD IS INFORMED OF EACH MEMBER'S BUSINESS. THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR MUST RECEIVE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE APPROVAL FOR A POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST. BOARD MEMBERS SUBMIT CONFLICTS ANNUALLY.

INDUSTRY COMPARISONS ON HISTORIC FORT WORTH'S EMPLOYEE COMPENSATION ARE CONDUCTED EVERY OTHER YEAR BY A HUMAN RESOURCE FIRM, THE WHITNEY G. SMITH CO, FORT WORTH, TEXAS. DUE TO YEAR-TO-YEAR REVENUE VOLATILITY, THE ORGANIZATION'S ACTAL SALARIES FALL ON THE MEDIUM TO LOW END OF THE RECOMMENDATIONS, OR ARE PAID BELOW THE RECOMMENDATIONS IN THESE STUDIES.
THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT MAKE ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC.
